solution_line_template: The first round will result in {initial_employees} * {layoff_percent_num}% = <<{initial_employees}*{layoff_percent_num}*{percent_factor}={first_round_layoffs}>>{first_round_layoffs} employee layoffs.

The second round will result in {after_first_round} * {layoff_percent_num}% = <<{after_first_round}*{layoff_percent_num}*{percent_factor}={second_round_layoffs}>>{second_round_layoffs} employee layoffs.

The third round will result in {after_second_round} * {layoff_percent_num}% = <<{after_second_round}*{layoff_percent_num}*{percent_factor}={third_round_layoffs}>>{third_round_layoffs} employee layoffs.

The total number of of employees laid off is {first_round_layoffs} + {second_round_layoffs} + {third_round_layoffs} = <<{first_round_layoffs}+{second_round_layoffs}+{third_round_layoffs}={total_laid_off}>>{total_laid_off}.
